subject: VPD Tool: Update Hardware
commitMessage:
VPD Tool: Update Hardware

Vpd tool has --Hardware/-H flag which should be given along
with writeKeyword flags, if the user wants to write directly to "Hardware".

In general the user should give only the object path in
--path/-P value.

Only if --Hardware/-H flag is given, the user has an
option to give either eeprom path or the object path in
--path/-P value.

Test:
Tested on simics.

./vpd-tool --writeKeyword -H --path < hardware path/object path > -R < record name > -K < keyword > -V < value in hex/ascii >

CASE 1: <updating eeprom path> < update directly on hardware using -H.>
./vpd-tool -u -H -P /sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/ahb:apb:bus@1e78a000/1e78a480.i2c-bus/i2c-8/8-0051/8-00510/nvmem -R VINI -K PN -V 0x717273
updation successful on both dbus and hardware.

CASE 2:
./vpd-tool -u -H -P /sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/ahb:apb:bus@1e78a000/1e78a480.i2c-bus/i2c-8/8-0051/8-00510/nvmem -R DINF -K FL -V 0x717273
updation successful on hardware. <this wont get updated in dbus as the given record-keyword pair is not required to update in dbus(only those record keywords
present in dbus_properties.json are required to be updated in dbus).

CASE 3: <failure case - invalid eeprom path>
root@rainier:/tmp# ./vpd-tool -u -H -P /sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/ahb:apb:bus@1e78a000/1e78a490.i2c-bus/i2c-8/8-0051/8-00510/nvmem -R VINI -K PN -V 0x717273
Invalid object path : /sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/ahb:apb:bus@1e78a000/1e78a490.i2c-bus/i2c-8/8-0051/8-00510/nvmem. Unable to find the corresponding EEPROM path for the given object path : /sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/ahb:apb:bus@1e78a000/1e7$

Signed-off-by: PriyangaRamasamy <priyanga24@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I6b893e699fe343c90c3a3fd2b07fd8b9a4711687

will remove this in next patch
I think this method is not required. Please refer me comments in vpd_tool_impl.cpp line 470.
to My*

a) Why we need the check for EEPROM presence here? The fruPath variable is set from vpd_tool.cpp after processing json itself, hence we got this path from json and checking it again in json is just redundant. Also, if it is blank, you are already throwing error there.
b) If eepromPresenceInJson is just used here, then also we do not need this method as editor updateKeyword api will try to open the file path and will set error if path is not found You can check for the error code there.
c) Now, if the check is anyhow needed here and EEPROM is not found in Json, then do we need to go ahead and call update method at all?

a) 
Am checking the eeprom presence in json for setting the updateCache value and not for throwing the error..

by default updateCache will set to true. (vpd-manager/editor_impl.hpp #109)

Only if the eeprom is not present in json / the given rec-kw pair is not present in dbus_properties.json - no need to updateCache.. so it will be set to false..

&&
 
in vpd_tool.cpp (line: 96) I will check for the eeprom path presence in the json only when the given path is a dbus object path.. 

if the given path is not the dbus object path & say it is the eeprom path - then no check is needed for its presence in json. (as sometimes we will get the eeprom which is not present in json)

b) I don't see - editor's updateKeyword is throwing error when the eeprom is not present in json..

c) yes.. sometimes we expect to update the vpd of those eeproms not present in our inventory json.

b) I am not saying editor's update keyword is throwing error. I am saying, if Stream open fails to open the eeprom path, it sets an error code internally. You can check the error code to establish the validity of eeprom path and can throw appropriate exception for better error handling.

c) I was not aware of this, hence point (a) also stands invalid. I guess check is needed in that case.

b) true - if the given vpd path is unable to open in a filestream - then we should throw an error.. that the updateKeyword is handling.. that is not handled here anywhere...

here I am just checking the given eeprom is present in json or not..

update keyword api is not handling that currently. Right now if the stream open fails there is no check to that, in case the eeprom path is invalid I think user should be notified to check/rectify that and also next statement is to seek the stream pointer which may give undefined behaviour if stream object is not set.
You can check the standard error code set by stream class in case of failure for invalid path and throw a runtime error stating that eeprom path is invalid which you can in turn cout to the user so that user can check for eeprom path that is being passed.
yes.. I can catch that failure case.
If your intention in defining the common_SOURCES was to reuse them, please do so here as well.
Ack
We can throw VpdJsonException for this. Please refer vpd_exceptions.hpp for details.

Well, then we need to pass JSON PATH to the exception - that is not known to this api.
Let me change the parameters a bit - will pass JSON PATH instead of JSON OBJECT.
Can we put the parse call under try catch? In case parsing throws an exception we should be able to handle that.
Done
Handle exception while call to parse?
Done
Throw VpdJsonException?
Done
Does this function actually need to be in util? Seems like it handles cases too specific to the vpd tool's update options.
Right. will move it out of util

This kind of a message is too generic to be placed in util. How do you know that the app that links this in even has a help option, or whether it even want to update anything? I would recommend either just returning an empty vector and let the caller do this handling.
I will move this api to VpdTool - so that i can have this message as such - which is specific to VpdTool updation.
Please name functions as verbs - So a better name is "isPathInJson"
Ack
Same here, please name functions better.
Ack
Same query here, why we need to change this to non const?
revereted back to const
Why do we need to change parameter to non const when we are not changing the kwdData in this method?
reverted back to const
Why can't this be an argument to updateKeyword? Why do we need a publicly accessible member?
yeah right.. updated accordingly
Please cleanup
Done
Tabs
Ack
Tabs
Ack
Tabs
Ack
This return will never get executed.
Removed

This api is dependent on commit
"https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openpower-vpd-parser/+/34636".

It will work only when the above commit is merged else it will always throw exception. 
@santosh Should we rebase this commit on top of the above commit or this is fine?
Please avoid using un-initialised local variable. This might lead to undefined behaviour.
Ack
Please don't define type in header file. It can cause issue in other files that might use this header file.
Done
We can use constant reference for bool as well?
Constant reference for bool as well.
Done
by default setting the updateCache as true.
Please avoid using uninitialised local variables.
Ack
Handle exception for call to parse.
Done

Don't use namespace declaration in header files.
Also if possible could you please fix the "using json = nlohmann::json;".
Done
Brief about the method and the method name is having same exact words. Adding brief hence is not actually adding any value. If possible can you explain some more.
